definition: low/beneath/to lower (one's head)/to let droop/to hang down/to incline

sentences.english: There was nothing except shacks and muddy streets.
sentences.chinese: 那时只有低矮的窝棚似的小房子和泥泞的道路。

sentences.english: They make low beds, on a pallet or a spread of straw.
sentences.chinese: 他们以简陋的床具或草铺卧于低矮之处。

sentences.english: The buildings are new and short and lack speciality and cultural atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 校园建筑崭新却低矮，没有特色，缺乏文化氛围。

sentences.english: Garlands of fruit and leaves wind along the lower arches.
sentences.chinese: 水果和树叶的花环缠绕在低矮的拱门上。

sentences.english: Three children and a mother were living in that small room with a low-ceiling.
sentences.chinese: 小屋的顶板低矮，里面住着三个孩子和一位母亲。

sentences.english: The corridor opened into a low smoky room.
sentences.chinese: 这条走廊通向一间烟雾弥漫的低矮房间。

sentences.english: He had to duck his head to get through the low doorway.
sentences.chinese: 他只得把头低下才能通过那低矮的门道。

sentences.english: Dip your head under the low arch.
sentences.chinese: 在低矮的门拱下要低头。

sentences.english: At the ground level an immense lawn is only interrupted by sandboxes and low vegetation arrangements.
sentences.chinese: 地面层广袤的草坪被零星的沙盒和低矮的植被点缀。

sentences.english: The next step is loading the lowboy trailer.
sentences.chinese: 下一步正将模块装上低矮的拖车。

sentences.english: Stretch denim skirt boasts a sexy low rise and a mid-thigh length.
sentences.chinese: 弹力牛仔裙拥有一个性感的低矮和大腿中部的长度。

sentences.english: So, it is the low baluster on Chinese ongoing journey only at most.
sentences.chinese: 那么，它最多只是中国前进路上低矮的栏杆。

sentences.english: The species were mainly in trees and low shrubs and the shrubs in middle-level were less.
sentences.chinese: 种类以乔木与低矮灌木为主，中间层次灌木较少。

sentences.english: On higher ground there are shrubs and shrub-like trees.
sentences.chinese: 再高一点，可见灌木丛和低矮树木。

sentences.english: I cracked my head on the low door-frame.
sentences.chinese: 我的头撞在低矮的门框上了。

sentences.english: She banged her head on the low ceiling.
sentences.chinese: 她的头砰地撞在低矮的天花板上。

definition: Pingfang district of Harbin 哈爾濱|哈尔滨[Ha1 er3 bin1] in Heilongjiang
in picturesque disorder (idiom); irregular arrangement with charming effect
